forecast-period.text: The monsoon trough lies from the north of Cape York Peninsula and over the northwest Coral Sea with a tropical low located on the trough well off the northeast Queensland coast. The low is expected to continue moving eastwards across the Coral Sea over the next few days. A weak ridge should gradually extend northwards along the east Queensland coast on Sunday and into early next week.

Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height. Wind warnings are issued for today and tomorrow and describe the highest category of wind warning for that day.
For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-360-427* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones. Marine forecasts are also available on VHF and HF radio. View the radio schedule on www.bom.gov.au/marine
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecasts for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for neighbouring coastal zones.

area.description: Cairns Coast: Cape Tribulation to Cardwell

forecast-period.text: Winds: South to southeasterly 10 to 15 knots, reaching up to 20 knots offshore in the morning. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing to 1 metre later in the evening. Swell: Easterly below 1 metre. Weather: Mostly sunny.

Winds: Southerly about 10 knots tending southeasterly 10 to 15 knots in the morning then decreasing to about 10 knots in the late evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: East to southeasterly 1 to 1.5 metres outside the reef. Weather: Partly cloudy. 30% chance of a shower.
Winds: Variable about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southeasterly 1 to 1.5 metres outside the reef. Weather: Partly cloudy. 50% chance of showers.
